goal.ch: This course is the second in a series of two*, devised to build up business-minded learners’ workplace English proficiency on four aspects of the language: vocabulary knowledge, listening comprehension, speaking techniques, and testing competency. Upon completion of education, students will be able to communicate more diplomatically, thereby more effectively, demonstrating functional language in everyday workplace scenarios. They will also gain confidence to take the TOEIC test when they are ready, aiming for a minimum score of 600, which can officially certify their workplace English level and appreciably enhance their employment profile.

outline.ch:
**課程內容與評量始自第一週，有選上或有興趣加選的同學，都請準時到課或向學校請假，避免成績損失。
**語言學習需要定期付出時間與努力才易有成效。
**課程須知會陸續公告於新ee-class系統: https://ncueeclass.ncu.edu.tw/，同學要每週追蹤網站上的課程注意事項。

**Our lessons and evaluations start from Week 1 for all students, the registered or the interested. If you can‘t make it, you can provide school approval for an excused absence or use our bonus scheme to make up for the loss.
**Language acquisition takes time and effort on a regular basis.
**Class announcements will be posted on new ee-class in due course: https://ncueeclass.ncu.edu.tw/. Students are required to follow the announcements posted on there on a weekly basis.

gradMethod.ch:
(tentative grading scheme)

1.Attendance / Activity / Attitude – 15％
2.Vocabulary Builders ＆ Read-a-text-aloud Assignments– 18％ (non-compensable)
3.Listening ＆ Vocabulary Achievement Tests – 34％ (T1 – 12％; T2 – 22％)
4.Mini TOEIC Test – 10％ (on self-learning contents: Book’s ‘Reviews’ and ‘Strategies’)
5.Term Project – 23％ (a formal business meeting)
6. (Bonus Credit) TOEIC*– 5％ or 10％
